medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in the morning of the day of admission with a severe generalized headache that worsened with movement and was not relieved by acetaminophen or ibuprofen. It was accompanied by nausea and one episode of nonbloody, nonbilious emesis. After returning to sleep and waking hours later, she experienced diffuse myalgias and noted a rash on her abdomen, chest, and right arm; the lesions were small, red, flat, nonpruritic, and nonpainful. Upon arriving at the emergency department, she reported resolution of nausea but developed mild neck stiffness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bacterial meningitis at 9 years of age, nephrolithiasis 10 months before current illness, remote history of hospitalization after a motor vehicle accident, and a history of anxiety.
medical_history.social_history: Lives alone, works as a lawyer, not recently traveled outside New England, new boyfriend but not currently sexually active, does not smoke or use illicit drugs, and rarely consumes alcohol. Had contact with her parents' two dogs, with no recent history of tick or mosquito bites.
